class.name: Skeleton2D
class.brief_description: Skeleton for 2D characters and animated objects.
class.description: Skeleton2D parents a hierarchy of [Bone2D] objects. It is a requirement of [Bone2D]. Skeleton2D holds a reference to the rest pose of its children and acts as a single point of access to its bones.

method.name: execute_modifications
method.description: Executes all the modifications on the [SkeletonModificationStack2D], if the Skeleton3D has one assigned.

method.name: get_bone
method.description: Returns a [Bone2D] from the node hierarchy parented by Skeleton2D. The object to return is identified by the parameter [code]idx[/code]. Bones are indexed by descending the node hierarchy from top to bottom, adding the children of each branch before moving to the next sibling.

method.name: get_bone_count
method.description: Returns the number of [Bone2D] nodes in the node hierarchy parented by Skeleton2D.

method.name: get_bone_local_pose_override
method.description: Returns the local pose override transform for [code]bone_idx[/code].

method.name: get_modification_stack
method.description: Returns the [SkeletonModificationStack2D] attached to this skeleton, if one exists.

method.name: get_skeleton
method.description: Returns the [RID] of a Skeleton2D instance.

method.name: set_bone_local_pose_override
method.description: Sets the local pose transform, [code]pose[/code], for the bone at [code]bone_idx[/code]. [code]amount[/code] is the interpolation strength that will be used when applying the pose, and [code]persistent[/code] determines if the applied pose will remain. [b]Note:[/b] The pose transform needs to be a local transform relative to the [Bone2D] node at [code]bone_idx[/code]!

method.name: set_modification_stack
method.description: Sets the [SkeletonModificationStack2D] attached to this skeleton.

signal.name: bone_setup_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the [Bone2D] setup attached to this skeletons changes. This is primarily used internally within the skeleton.
